dialogue.text: That guy sounds awfully familiar. I swear I saw his name on a poster you used to have in your room or something.
Smoky? Yeah, he was the lead bass player in 7-Spice. I used to have a lot of their posters and CDs.
Yeah, that's right! 7-Spice! I remember you playing their albums and wearing their merch all the time!
Heh, I remember you even had a crush on the lead singer, too.
Eughhh, yeah...
I... I never told you why I stopped listening to that group, didn't I, Syn?
I just figured they were a phase or something. Didn't know there was more to it.
Well… Anyone tuning into stream today who knew about 7-Spice knows that they had a falling out not too long ago.
That news hit me like a truck when I found out. I wanted to hold onto all the albums and memorabilia I had of the band as much as I could, knowing that there wouldn't ever be more, but then…
The lead singer went on this big tirade on social media that just… I don't know. It made it seem like the falling out was for the better.
It's not the kind of thing I'd want to delve into on stream, though. Just a lot of gross drama nonsense I don't like.
I'm curious why Smoky's name has been cropping up lately. Did something new happen with 7-Spice recently?
You saw what happened in Togarashi Town last week.
Sweet and Sour had that whole performance with Smoky and that redhead girl, Spicy. The one with all the crazy, RAVE-y superpower stuff everywhere.
You've been watching it nonstop ever since its been posted online.
Yeah, I've seen that recording nearly a hundred times! But, wait… that's Smoky in the video?
He looks so much different than how he looked in 7-Spice. And I thought he played bass guitar. Did he drop bass and pick up shamisen after the band split?
Just did some quick research. It turns out Smoky's been playing shamisen much longer than bass guitar. That must be why he's an absolute beast on that thing.
I can't find too much else on the guy though. Looks like we'll have to keep our eyes on him and Spicy.
If Smoky's moved onto a new group with Spicy... I wonder what's happened with the other six members of 7-Spice...
